data.title: Steele Chambers
data.meta_description: Steele Chambers (22) Linebacker - Follow on Social Media Twitter: @steelec22 Instagram: @steele_chambers22 Ohio State Overview • Steele was a three-year star...
data.text:
Follow on Social Media

Twitter: @steelec22

Instagram: @steele_chambers22

Ohio State Overview• Steele was a three-year starter at linebacker for the Buckeyes and played a total of five seasons, including his first two years as a running back

• Had one more season of eligibility remaining because of the COVID-19 season of 2020, but elected to turn pro and prepare for the NFL Draft

• He earned four Varsity O letters and graduated in the spring of 2023 with his degree in finance

• Played in 50 games: four and seven games at running back in 2019 and 2020, respectively; and 39 at linebacker the past three seasons

• He was a sturdy, speedy and standout linebacker for the Buckeyes the past after switching from running back to linebacker during the 2021 fall camp

• Recorded 207 tackles, including a team-leading 83 in 2023 and 77 in 2022 to rank second on the team

• Started 29 games at linebacker; the last four games in 2021, all 13 in 2022 and 12 in 2023

• His 2023 stats included a team-high 41 solo tackles and his fourth career interception, vs. Western Kentucky

• Had a career-high 13 tackles at Michigan and eight vs. both Western Kentucky and vs. Missouri in the Goodyear Cotton Bowl

• 2022 season stats included 6.5 TFLs and an interception vs. Rutgers

• Recoverd a fumble and scored from the 1 to clinch the 43-30 win over Maryland

• Established a then-career-high with 11 tackles (and eight solo stops) vs. Rutgers and also had 10 vs. Indiana, nine vs. Penn State, and eight vs. both Northwestern and vs. Georgia in the CFP semifinals at the Peach Bowl

• First two interceptions came vs. Nebraska and Purdue in 2021

• Played in all 13 games in 2021 and started four times at linebacker

• Ranked fifth on the team with 47 tackles

• Played in a total of 11 games for the Buckeyes as a running back/special teamer in 2019 and 2020, including playing in seven of eight contests in 2020

• Has career rushing stats of 221 yards off 28 carries with a 7.9 yards per carry average

• Averaged 9.6 yards per carry in 2020 with 87 rush yards off nine carries

• Had 63 yards on eight carries and his first collegiate touchdown vs. Miami (Ohio) in 2019 for his high game rushing

• Off the field, is a two-time OSU Scholar-Athlete and a two-time Academic All-Big Ten honoree

Honors & Awards

2023: Graduated in April with his degree in finance, third-team all-Big Ten Conference (media)

2022: Honorable mention All-Big Ten Conference (coaches & media)

2021: Academic All-Big Ten, honorable mention all-Big Ten (media)

2020: Academic All-Big Ten, OSU Scholar-Athlete

2019: OSU Scholar-Athlete

More on Steele

• Was rated as a four-star prospect by 247Sports and among the top 20 athletes nationwide

• A three-year starter for head coach Tim McFarlin

• Ran for 244 yards and three TDs while also throwing a touchdown pass to help Blessed Trinity Catholic advance to the Georgia 4A state title game

• In the title game, ran for 98 yards and added five tackles on defense as Blessed Trinity won its second straight championship

• Over 1,500 yards and 25 touchdowns as a senior

• Georgia’s Region 7AAAA Player of the Year in 2017 for the state champion Titans

• Exceptional athlete who stood out as both a linebacker and running back

• All-Georgia honoree as an athlete from the Atlanta Journal Constitution

• Georgia Athletic Coaches Association all-state selection as a linebacker

• Rushed for 1,486 yards (6.9 yards per carry) as a sophomore and 1,301 as a junior

• Scored the go-ahead touchdown in the 2017 state title game

• On defense, totaled 70 tackles (37 solo), six tackles for loss and 2.5 sacks

• Parents are Stacy and Eric Chambers
